thread.title: Bronx woman busted for stealing cash from church donation box
thread.title_full: Bronx woman busted for stealing cash from church donation box

author: Aidan McLaughlin
title: Bronx woman busted for stealing cash from church donation box
text:
Bronx woman busted for stealing cash from church donation box Bronx woman busted for stealing cash from church donation box NEW YORK DAILY NEWS Thursday, February 9, 2017, 7:11 AM 
Cops busted a 30-year-old woman for stealing cash from a donation box at a Bronx church, police said Thursday. 
Christa Polito of the East Bronx was arrested on Wednesday, nearly a month after she walked into St. Benedict's Roman Catholic Church in Throggs Neck and swiped cash from a donation box, cops said. 
Security footage from the church caught Polito as she pried open a locked donation box and made off with an undisclosed amount of cash around 4:30 p.m. Jan. 12. The woman was arrested for the unholy crime on Wednesday. 
The sacrilegious crime was committed under a framed photo of Mother Teresa, and next to a statue of the Virgin Mary. 
Authorities charged Polito with petit larceny. Join the Conversation:
